newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CSR says housing recovery signs encouraging.
newsitem.headline: CSR says housing recovery signs encouraging.

text.p: CSR Ltd said on Monday that signs of improvement in the housing industry were encouraging but the recovery was patchy to date and tilted towards high rise apartments.

"However, indications are that the traditional detached housing market is starting to improve and overall that should result in stronger demand for CSR's building materials," said chairman Alan Coates.
Coates said CSR had achieved some modest price increases in the past few months.
However, the bulk of a planned profit improvement would come from cost reductions, productivity improvements and volume increases, he said.
Coates said CSR's new fibre cement plant was now producing a full range of products and would be profitable this year, its second year of operations.
Building materials had shown healthy margin increases since the start of the current financial year, he added.
Coates said the improvement in activity in construction materials was clearer, and demand was encouraging.
Part of an expected profit improvement should come from modest price increases, but CSR would benefit mainly from reducing overheads and rationalising production facilities.
Results from Asian operations were expected to improve, and no new plants were planned in the immediate future.

"The improvements achieved with construction materials in the first three months of this year, through lower overheads, reduced operating costs and better asset utilisation, have resulted in good margin gains," Coates said.
The contract mining forward order book had been increased by A$30 million, he added.
